column4: I don't want to run Vista, I have work to do. Win XP is just so I can play games with my kids.
Dell? This is a lenovo T500. There is no dell here.
Well, dmesg doesn't help me much. I rebotted it again, still nothing.
It finished, and the first thing it wanted to do was download and install some updates. Now gnome is hosed.
No, I can log in via the console... but there is no X running that I can seem to get to.
During boot up, it shows a useless progress bar.
I can turn that off in grub, can't I?
lst, rather
let's consider reinstalling the OS
is a new install appropriate?
is a new install appropriate? The laptop came with Vista. First thing I did was install XP on a little piece of the drive, then Ubuntu on the rest.
youre not going to be able to run xp very easily
your hardware is newer than your OS and drivers will be a PITA
why do you say that? It runs just fine, when I choose it from grub...
heh, well, I don't care much.
in my personal experience with dell
i had vista problems on MY Dell
so i went to xp
at which point drivers became hell
so now i'm all ubuntu =)
consider ubuntu as primare and maybe vmware?
